references.reason: This paper introduces a groundbreaking approach to text-to-image generation, achieving high-quality results without explicit training on specific image-text pairs, which is highly relevant to the current paper's dual-learning framework.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper significantly advances the field of image generation, achieving high-resolution images with superior quality using latent diffusion models, forming a crucial foundation for the current paper's image generation component.

references.paper_title: Taming transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces significant improvements in high-resolution image synthesis using transformers, a core technology used in the current paper's text-to-image generation model, and hence is directly relevant to the methods proposed.

references.paper_title: Structured denoising diffusion models in discrete state-spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of discrete diffusion models, which are particularly relevant to the current work, as they handle discrete representations and efficiently work with graph structures, aligning perfectly with the model used in the paper.

references.paper_title: Visual spatial description: Controlled spatial-oriented image-to-text generation
references.reason: This is a foundational paper for the current work, introducing the visual spatial description task and dataset that are central to the evaluation of the model proposed in the current paper, making it a key reference.
